{{Outdated feature|edition=bedrock}}
[[File:terrain-atlas.tga|thumb|<samp>terrain-atlas.tga</samp> in [[Pocket Edition v0.14.3 alpha|v0.14.3]], the last version to actually use this file.]]

<samp>'''terrain-atlas.tga'''</samp> and the mipmap variants <samp>'''terrain-atlas_mip0.tga'''</samp>, <samp>'''terrain-atlas_mip1.tga'''</samp>, <samp>'''terrain-atlas_mip2.tga'''</samp> and <samp>'''terrain-atlas_mip3.tga'''</samp> were [[texture atlas]]es found inside <samp>minecraft.apk</samp> that were used to load the game's block textures.

== Format ==
<samp>terrain-atlas.tga</samp> is a fixed-width 512×256-pixel file that is split into different 16×16 squares which correspond to the texture of each block found in-game.

<samp>terrain-atlas_mip0.tga</samp> is a 256×128-pixel, <samp>terrain-atlas_mip1.tga</samp> 128×64-pixel, <samp>terrain-atlas_mip2.tga</samp> 64×32-pixel and <samp>terrain-atlas_mip3.tga</samp> 32×16-pixel files that is split into different 8×8, 4×4, 2×2 and 1×1 squares which correspond to the mipmap texture of each block found in-game.
